description: From Medieval Latin nadir, from Arabic نَظِير السَّمْت‎ (naẓīr as-samt), composed of نَظِير‎ (naẓīr, “counterpart, corresponding to”) and السَّمْت‎ (as-samt, “the zenith”)

entries.meaning: The point of the celestial sphere, directly opposite the zenith; inferior pole of the horizon; point of the celestial sphere directly under the place of observation.
(figuratively) The lowest point; time of greatest depression.
examples: Synonyms: lowest ebb, slough of despond, trough, bathos

entries.meaning: (astronomy) The axis of a projected conical shadow; the direction of the force of gravity at a location; down.
examples: The nadir of the sun is the axis of the shadow projected by the Earth.

entries.meaning: (beekeeping, archaic) An empty box added beneath a full one in a beehive to give the colony more room to expand or store honey.

verbs.description: nadir (third-person singular simple present nadirs, present participle nadiring, simple past and past participle nadired)

entries.meaning: (transitive, beekeeping) To extend (a beehive) by adding an empty box at the base.
